member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.LinearTransferEffect
member.summary: Alters the colors of an image by applying a per-channel linear transfer function.

remarks.p: This effect is supported by Windows.UI.Composition since Windows 10 build 14393 (Anniversary Update).
The linear transfer function is evaluated separately for each color channel:

Effect inputs and outputs are assumed to be in premultiplied alpha format, but this effect operates internally on straight alpha data, so its input values will be unpremultiplied, then the transfer function applied, and finally the result converted back to premultiplied format.
This Windows Runtime type corresponds to the D2D Linear transfer effect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.LinearTransferEffect.ClampOutput
member.summary: If set, the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before passing them on to the next effect in the graph. If false, the effect will not clamp values, although subsequent effects or the output surface may later clamp if they are not of high enough precision. Default value false.
